business.headline: Elon Musk to pocket $1,000,000,000,000. What will he do with all the money?Elon Musk has been one of the world's richest people for several years now. And a $1 trillion pay package, which comes with conditions, will only make him richer. It has led social media to wonder how Musk, who is known not to live an extravagant life, will spend his money.

Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.

Gold vs real estate: Where should you invest?Safe glitter or solid bricks? Investors have always loved gold and property, but choosing between the two can be tricky. With inflation, demand, and prices on the rise, it's time to ask—where you should put your money.

Adani Power bags Bhagalpur's 2,400 MW project tenderFour qualified bidders participated in the tender, with Adani Power quoting the lowest electricity tariff of Rs 6.075 per kWh (or per unit), sources with direct knowledge of the bidding process said.

Gold trades at around Rs 1.21 lakh per 10 grams: Should you buy or wait?Gold's shine shows no sign of fading as global uncertainty, a weak dollar, and festive demand keep prices high. But should investors buy now or wait for the next dip?
Sensex, Nifty end week in red amid weak global cues and FII sellingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 94.73 points to end at 83,216.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.40 points to close at 25,492.30.

BSE share price jumps nearly 9% despite market slump. Here's what drove the rallyAt the end of the trading session on November 7, BSE shares closed 8.61% higher at Rs 2,666.90 apiece on the NSE, bucking the overall market trend.

Lenskart IPO listing next week: Will it deliver profits or disappoint?Lenskart IPO received a strong response from investors, and was subscribed 28.27 times overall, indicating robust demand across categories.

Not 1, 3, or Rs 5 crore. Here's how much Shiv Nadar donated per day last yearShiv Nadar and his family donated a total of Rs 2,708 crore in the last year, which comes to nearly Rs 7.4 crore per day. This is the fourth time in five years that Nadar has topped the list.

Why urban millennials are renting lifestyle products instead of buying themUrban millennials are rewriting the rules of ownership. Instead of buying lifestyle products, from furniture to gadgets, they're choosing to rent. The reason? Flexibility, affordability, and freedom from long-term commitments.

Planning voluntary retirement under UPS? All you need to knowThe guidelines aim to offer clarity and smoother planning for retirement decisions, ensuring eligible employees understand their rights, timelines, and benefits under UPS.

Groww IPO closes today. Here's what the latest GMP signalsWith the IPO closing today, attention now shifts to final subscription numbers and post-allotment reactions. Analysts expect a modestly positive debut given the strong retail response and steady grey market sentiment.

Financial watchdog to seek RBI's help in IndusInd Bank forex hedging probeAs of now, EOW officials have recorded statements of around 12 people from IndusInd Bank, which includes the former top management and other employees in connection with the ongoing investigations into the accounting lapse at the bank of Rs 2000 crore.

Why a magical 12% SIP may not give you solid returns? Expert breaks it downEither compare everything in nominal terms, without adjusting for inflation, or adjust every single figure — contributions, taxes, fees, and final value — for inflation, says expert.

Gold and silver are rising again. What's driving the fresh rally?On Friday morning, gold futures on the MCX were trading around Rs 1,21 lakh per 10 grams, while silver was trading over Rs 1,48 lakh per kg. Both metals have rebounded from their one-week lows, aided by a weaker US dollar and fresh geopolitical tensions.

Elon Musk's $1 trillion payday sounds huge. But can he actually earn it?To actually collect on this historic paycheque, Musk must achieve what Tesla's board calls "Mars-shot milestones", a suite of operational and financial targets.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why stock market is down todayThe broad-based weakness comes as investors continue to digest a mix of global uncertainties, ranging from geopolitical tensions to expectations of prolonged high interest rates in the US.

Lenskart IPO allotment out: Check latest GMP, listing date and moreLenskart's IPO allotment is done, but all eyes are now on its stock market debut. With strong demand and a steady GMP, will India's eyewear leader deliver clear gains?

Bharti Airtel shares tumble 4% in early trade. What's behind the fall?At 9:29 am, Bharti Airtel shares were down 3.66% at Rs 2,018 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with heavy volumes recorded in the opening minutes of trade. The decline came even as broader market sentiment remained weak.

Sensex falls 500 points, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel falls over 3%At 9:19 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 456.75 points at 82,854.26, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 129.40 points to 25,380.30. All major sectoral indices opened lower, led by losses in banking, IT and metal stocks.

entertainment.headline: Did Rashmika Mandanna just confirm she'd marry Vijay Deverakonda? Watch the video Rashmika Mandanna opened up about her idea of love and the kind of partner she wants, saying she values loyalty and someone who would "fight a war" with her. Her comments come amid strong rumours that she and Vijay Deverakonda are engaged and planning a February 2026 wedding.

Dhurandhar: Ranveer Singh introduces Arjun Rampal as Angel of Death. First look Arjun Rampal's fierce first look from 'Dhurandhar' has fans buzzing after Ranveer Singh called him an "Angel of Death." The Aditya Dhar directorial, also starring Sanjay Dutt and Akshaye Khanna, releases on December 5, 2025.

Four More Shots Please actors Kirti Kulhari, Rajeev Siddhartha dating: Sources  'Four More Shots Please!' co-stars Kirti Kulhari and Rajeev Siddhartha are reportedly dating after growing close while working together on the show. Though the actors haven't made their relationship official, their affectionate social media posts and pictures have sparked buzz among fans.

Gouri Kishan issues statement after body-shaming incident. Read it here Actor Gouri Kishan stood up against a journalist who made a comment about her weight during a press meet for her film 'Others'. After the video went viral, she shared a statement saying such questions are wrong and urged people to treat everyone with more respect and sensitivity.

Anushka Sharma's Chakda Xpress release in talks as makers appeal to Netflix: Report After years of delay, the makers of Anushka Sharma's 'Chakda Xpress' have urged Netflix to release the long-awaited Jhulan Goswami biopic, following the Indian women's cricket team's recent historic win. The film, completed in 2022, had reportedly been stuck due to creative disagreements and budget concerns.

Jeremy Renner accused of misconduct by filmmaker Yi Zhou: He threatened to call ICE Chinese filmmaker Yi Zhou has accused Hollywood star Jeremy Renner of sending her unsolicited explicit images and threatening to call US immigration authorities on her after she confronted him about his behaviour.

Baahubali series to Mirzapur movie: The great screen swap has arrived Indian entertainment is witnessing a dynamic shift as films turn into series and web shows make their way to the big screen. Audiences today crave stories that go beyond a single format, seeking deeper, more immersive experiences across every platform.

A decade later, Baahubali the Epic reveals its deepest truths As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit 'Baahubali', the grand spectacle that redefined Indian cinema, to uncover its buried moral questions and rediscover why its tragedy still resonates.

Jatadhara box office Day 1: Sonakshi Sinha, Sudheer Babu film opens with Rs 20 lakh Sonakshi Sinha and Sudheer Babu's supernatural thriller 'Jatadhara' opened to positive reviews but a weak box office start, earning around Rs 20 lakh on Day 1.

Haq box office Day 1: Yami Gautam-Emraan Hashmi's drama crosses Rs 2 crore mark Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's courtroom drama 'Haq' opened to positive reviews and surpassed Rs 2 crore on day one. Inspired by Shah Bano Begum's landmark case, the film's powerful dialogues and performances are winning audience praise.

Frankenstein review: Guillermo del Toro breathes soul into the monster taleRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025 Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' is a haunting reimagining of the classic, bringing science and sorrow together. Starring Oscar Isaac and Jacob Elordi, it trades horror for humanity, exploring love, loneliness, and the fragile heart that defines us all.

When Kajol was schooled by Farah Khan: Every woman is relevant even if not working Kajol's comment to Farah Khan about being "relevant" on her talk show 'Too Much' with Twinkle Khanna has sparked backlash online, with many praising Farah for her dignified response. The exchange reignited debates around respect and relevance that individuals deserve.

Rama Shama Bhama: Absolute laughter riot driven by Kamal Haasan, Ramesh Aravind 'Rama Shama Bhama' is a 2005 Kannada comedy-drama film which had acclaimed actor Ramesh Aravind debuting as a director. This classic featuring Ramesh Aravind, also featured Kamal Haasan, Urvashi and Daisy Bopanna among several other prominent actors.

Grammy 2026 nominations: Kendrick Lamar leads with nine, Lady Gaga scores seven Kendrick Lamar leads the 2026 Grammy nominations with nine nods, followed closely by Lady Gaga with seven, as the Recording Academy unveils this year's contenders ahead of the February 1 ceremony in Los Angeles.

Bigg Boss 19 Day 75: Pranit More's comeback leaves Farrhana, Tanya upset Pranit More made his way back into the 'Bigg Boss 19' house after recovering from health issues, but not everyone welcomed him warmly. Farrhana Bhatt and Tanya Mittal were noticeably unhappy with his return.

Shraddha Kapoor voices Judy Hopps in Hindi for Disney's Zootopia 2 Actor Shraddha Kapoor has joined Disney animated film 'Zootopia 2' as the Hindi voice of Judy Hopps. The film is set for a theatrical release on November 28.

Rajinikanth to be felicitated at IFFI closing ceremony for 50 years in cinema The 56th International Film Festival of India will pay tribute to the five-decade cinematic journey of Rajinikanth. The event will be held in Goa from November 20 to 28 and feature over 240 films.

Zayed Khan bids tearful farewell to his mother Zarine. Video The last rites of Zarine Khan were held with Hindu rituals in Mumbai on Friday. Videos from the ceremony show her son and actor Zayed Khan controlling his tears at the ceremony.

All Her Fault: Sarah Snook's thriller addresses every parent's worst nightmare Sarah Snook's mystery-thriller series 'All Her Fault' released on November 6, 2025. The show addresses every parent's concern about their child's safety.

general news.headline: They're giving pistols to children, we're giving laptops: PM's dig at RJDPrime Minister Narendra Modi accused the RJD of trying to turn the state's youth into hooligans while asserting that the NDA is empowering them with education, technology, and opportunities.

It's a shame Indira didn't approve strike on Pak nuke facility: Ex-CIA officerRichard Barlow said the proposed India–Israel strike on Pakistan's Kahuta nuclear facility in the early 1980s could have resolved many problems had it gone ahead.
Bhaiya mat karo: Woman says Rapido driver tried to grab her legs during rideA Bengaluru woman's allegation that a Rapido driver touched her inappropriately during a ride has triggered outrage online.

After India war lessons, Pak plans a unified command. More power for Munir?Months after its brief but bruising military confrontation with India, Pakistan is moving to constitutionally overhaul its military command structure. It is going to create a powerful new post for a unified command of its army, navy, and air force. The move will see army chief Asim Munir gain with the civilian government ceding power.

Elon Musk to pocket $1,000,000,000,000. What will he do with all the money?Elon Musk has been one of the world's richest people for several years now. And a $1 trillion pay package, which comes with conditions, will only make him richer. It has led social media to wonder how Musk, who is known not to live an extravagant life, will spend his money.

5th T20I Live: Rain lashes out at Gabba, match set for lengthy delayIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS), Live Score and Updates 5th T20I: Rain has lashed out at the Gabba, and we are set for a lengthy delay. Earlier, lightning had stopped play after 4.5 overs, where India's openers brought up 52 runs.

Video: BJP MLA, security personnel clash at Banaras station during PM's visitA brief scuffle broke out at Banaras station between BJP MLA Saurabh Srivastava and RPF personnel over restricted access, just hours before PM Modi flagged off four Vande Bharat Express trains from Banaras railway station.

With Islamists at the helm, can Bangladesh deliver free, fair elections?Once hailed as a non-violent, student-led uprising for justice and fair elections, the quota reform movement now stands exposed as an armed conspiracy of Jamaat-e-Islami. The Islamists are trying for a new state structure, resembling the era of Pakistan rule. The current regime isn't neutral and does not intend to hold free and fair elections.

When Kajol was schooled by Farah Khan: Every woman is relevant even if not workingKajol's comment to Farah Khan about being "relevant" on her talk show 'Too Much' with Twinkle Khanna has sparked backlash online, with many praising Farah for her dignified response. The exchange reignited debates around respect and relevance that individuals deserve.

Sorry, couldn't fulfil your dreams: NEET aspirant in suicide note to parentsA 21-year-old NEET aspirant from Uttar Pradesh died by suicide in a Kanpur hostel. In his note, he expressed regret over not being able to fulfil his parents' dream.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.
Woman, 40, dies after being attacked by boy, 14, for resisting sexual assaultA 14-year-old minor fatally attacked a woman in Hamirpur while attempting a sexual assault in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur.

Did Rashmika Mandanna just confirm she'd marry Vijay Deverakonda? Watch the videoRashmika Mandanna opened up about her idea of love and the kind of partner she wants, saying she values loyalty and someone who would "fight a war" with her. Her comments come amid strong rumours that she and Vijay Deverakonda are engaged and planning a February 2026 wedding.

How Shah Rukh Khan saved Cheteshwar Pujara's career in 2009Book Excerpt: Cheteshwar Pujara's cricket career nearly ended due to a knee injury in 2009. Back then, Shah Rukh Khan personally played a pivotal role to provide complete support to the cricketer.

Drunk cop rams bikes in Madhya Pradesh, kills one, injures 4 including childrenA road accident in Jawad led to one death and four injuries after ASI Manoj Yadav allegedly drove recklessly. The incident raised concerns over alleged drunk driving and prompted police action including arrest and suspension.

IIM grad's Rs 3,000 offline AI tool to screen heart, lung disease wins Dyson AwardIIM-Kashipur innovator Tunir Sahoo has won the James Dyson Award India 2025 for JivaScope, a Rs 3,000 pocket-sized AI device that screens heart and lung issues without doctors, electricity, or internet. Built through 20+ iterations, it empowers ASHA workers with instant, clinical-grade reports, bringing diagnostics to rural India.

Abhishek fastest to 1000 T20I runs, but Virat Kohli ahead of him. Here's howAbhishek Sharma's blazing form showed no signs of slowing down as he surged to the top of the T20I run charts, becoming the fastest batter to reach 1000 runs during the fifth India-Australia match at the Gabba on Saturday.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Story of the birth of Vande Mataram, India's eternal soul cryOn November 7, 1875, Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay composed Vande Mataram, inspired by Bengal's spirit of Durga Puja. This six-stanza hymn fused Sanskrit grandeur with Bengali melody to become a spiritual and patriotic anthem that fueled India's freedom struggle, and also controversy.

Vishwaguru will attend in person: Congress's swipe at PM after Trump boycotts G20US President Trump will skip the G20 Summit in South Africa, while PM Modi is set to attend in person, prompting Congress leader Jairam Ramesh to take a pointed dig at the Prime Minister.

Audiences today crave stories that go beyond a single format, seeking deeper, more immersive experiences across every platform.
Does a degree from a top college really matter in Indian arranged marriages?When it comes to choosing a life partner, would you value their education more or the bond and understanding you share?

Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.

Air India passengers stranded for 7 hours in Mumbai as snag delays UK flightMumbai airport: The Mumbai-London flight, originally scheduled to take off at 6.30 am from Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, will now depart at 1 pm.

Did Rashmika Mandanna just confirm she'd marry Vijay Deverakonda? Watch the videoRashmika Mandanna opened up about her idea of love and the kind of partner she wants, saying she values loyalty and someone who would "fight a war" with her. Her comments come amid strong rumours that she and Vijay Deverakonda are engaged and planning a February 2026 wedding.

Huma Qureshi In Bihar: 'Maharani' Star On Politics, Power & Her 'Bihari Aatma'This special report features actor Huma Qureshi in Patna, discussing the political drama 'Maharani' and its deep connections to Bihar's political landscape. 'English is not a metric to identify ki aap kitne intelligent hain,' Qureshi states, emphasizing that her character Rani Bharti's strength comes from native wisdom, not formal education. The interview delves into the evolution of her character, which is inspired by the journey of an uneducated woman thrust into power, drawing parallels to figures like former Chief Minister Rabri Devi. Qureshi shares insights into the upcoming fourth season of the show, her own career trajectory from 'Gangs of Wasseypur' to pan-Indian cinema, and her views on the need for more female role models in both fiction and real-life politics. The conversation also touches upon her debut novel, 'Zeba: An Accidental Superhero'.

sports.headline: Mohun Bagan SG suspend first-team amidst ISL's commercial rights limbo: Report Mohun Bagan Super Giant have reportedly suspended first-team operations as the Indian Super League remains on hold due to unresolved commercial rights issues. The club says they will return once there is clarity on when the league will resume, with delays likely into mid-January.

Pant overcomes injury scare, bats again after retiring hurt in India A game Rishabh Pant overcame injury setback to bat again in India's second unofficial Test against South Africa A. The wicketkeeper batter was hit twice in the first session before getting retired hurt.

Rohit trains at Ranji Trophy venue, begins preparation for South Africa ODIs India vs South Africa: Weeks ahead of the ODI series opener, Rohit Sharma began training in Mumbai. The former captain was seen training at the BKC ground where Mumbai's Ranji Trophy team took on Himachal Pradesh.

Physios monitor Pant after retiring hurt vs South Africa A, but no major injury India A skipper Rishabh Pant was forced to retire hurt after being hit thrice by South Africa A pacer Tshepo Moreki on the third day of the four-day match on Saturday. His fitness remains under observation ahead of India's upcoming Test series against South Africa.

Abhishek fastest to 1000 T20I runs, but Virat Kohli ahead of him. Here's how Abhishek Sharma's blazing form showed no signs of slowing down as he surged to the top of the T20I run charts, becoming the fastest batter to reach 1000 runs during the fifth India-Australia match at the Gabba on Saturday.

India continue experimenting, rest Tilak Varma for forgotten star in Gabba India vs Australia, 5th T20I: India made one change to their playing XI with Rinku Singh replacing Tilak Varma for the final T20I against Australia at the Gabba. Rinku got his second game in nine months in T20Is for India.

Shivam Dube has ensured India don't feel Hardik Pandya's absence: Abhishek Nayar Shivam Dube helped India take a 2-1 lead in the five-match series with his brilliant all-round performance in Gold Coast. He has stepped up in Hardik Pandya's absence from the team in the Asia Cup final.

Hockey: Sanjay to lead India in Sultan Azlan Shah Cup, seniors rested Defender Sanjay will captain the Indian men's hockey team at the 31st Sultan Azlan Shah Cup, with several senior players rested for the prestigious invitational tournament to be held in Ipoh, Malaysia, from November 23 to 30.

5th T20I Live: Rain lashes out at Gabba, match set for lengthy delay India (IND) vs Australia (AUS), Live Score and Updates 5th T20I: Rain has lashed out at the Gabba, and we are set for a lengthy delay. Earlier, lightning had stopped play after 4.5 overs, where India's openers brought up 52 runs.

Rishabh Pant suffers injury scare in India A game, days before SA Tests Rishabh Pant suffered an injury during Day 3 of the 2nd unofficial Test against South Africa A at BCCI Centre of Excellence. He was struck twice in the morning session, first on his left arm, and later near the groin area before eventually leaving the field.

India continue experimenting, rest Tilak Varma for forgotten star in Gabba India vs Australia, 5th T20I: India made one change to their playing XI with Rinku Singh replacing Tilak Varma for the final T20I against Australia at the Gabba. Rinku got his second game in nine months in T20Is for India.

He was struck twice in the morning session, first on his left arm, and later near the groin area before eventually leaving the field.

Manchester United's Ruben Amorim relaxed despite Benjamin Sesko's lack of formRuben Amorim has admitted that Benjamin Sesko is finding it difficult to settle at Manchester United and urged the young striker to handle criticism as part of everyday life, "like a normal Monday."

Who are the overseas-born talents that Indian football team can call-up?With Ryan Williams becoming an Indian citizen and Abneet Bharti on trial, AIFF is looking to overseas talent to strengthen the national team. The OCI rule could bring in experience and skill from Indian-origin players abroad.

Josh Hazlewood confident in Australia's ageing bowling attack for AshesAustralia pacer Josh Hazlewood has dismissed concerns about the team's ageing bowling attack ahead of the Ashes, insisting he feels in peak condition and that the group's experience together remains one of its biggest strengths.

Hong Kong Sixes: After Pakistan win, Karthik's India lose to Nepal, UAE & KuwaitIndia endured a disappointing day at the ongoing Hong Kong Sixes on Saturday, losing all three matches and failing to qualify for the quarterfinals. After kick-starting their campaign with a thrilling win over arch-rivals Pakistan, the Dinesh Karthik-led side went down to Kuwait, the UAE and Nepal in succession.

BCCI raises Asia Cup trophy issue; ICC forms panel to resolve dispute: SourcesThe ICC has formed a committee to mediate the dispute between India and Pakistan over the Asia Cup 2025 trophy, following a formal complaint raised by the BCCI during its meeting in Dubai, sources told India Today on Friday.

Liverpool perfect opponents for 1,000th game as manager: Man City's GuardiolaPep Guardiola is set to oversee his 1,000th match in management when Manchester City face rivals Liverpool. The Spaniard reflected on his journey, his enduring rivalry with Liverpool, and the significance of reaching this milestone against such a familiar opponent.

Cricket's return to the Olympics will strengthen the bond with India: IOC presidentIOC president Kirsty Coventry has welcomed the return of cricket to the Olympics, saying its inclusion at Los Angeles 2028 will strengthen the IOC's connection with Indian fans.

Michael Vaughan compares India vs Australia to Ashes, gets trolled on XMichael Vaughan compared the hype and quality of India and England's Test series against Australia. As expected, Vaughan claimed that the Ashes was the bigger contest. He was almost immediately trolled on X for trying to create what many fans called fake hype around the series.

I hated facing you: PV Sindhu's heartfelt tribute to retiring Tai Tzu YingTwo-time Olympic medalist PV Sindhu penned a heartfelt tribute to Tai Tzu-Ying, reflecting on the on-field rivalry they had built over the years, which eventually blossomed into "a quiet friendship."

Has India learnt its lesson from Arshdeep experiment ahead of T20 World Cup?Arshdeep Singh proved his worth with crucial wickets in the Australia T20I series, reigniting debate over the team management's earlier decisions.

AUS vs IND, 5th T20I Weather forecast: Will rain threaten the Gabba finale?AUS vs IND: India and Australia clash in a winner-takes-all finale at the Gabba, with the series on the line. Clouds and rain could yet play spoilsport, but fans hope for a full-throttle contest.

Jannik Sinner beats Carlos Alcaraz again, gets big boost before ATP FinalsJannik Sinner defeated Carlos Alcaraz 6‑3 in a practice set ahead of the ATP Finals, despite Alcaraz leading their head-to-head 10‑5. The tournament, running from November 9–16, features Sinner in the Bjorn Borg Group and Alcaraz in the Jimmy Connors Group alongside Novak Djokovic and Taylor Fritz.

Did Sunil Chhetri hint at retiring from professional football after the 2025-26 season?Sunil Chhetri has called time on his international career and hinted at leaving club football if Bengaluru FC doesn't clinch the ISL. India now faces the challenge of finding a striker to replace the legend.

Novak Djokovic snaps semis losing streak, storms to Hellenic Championships finalNovak Djokovic ended a four-match semi-final losing streak by defeating Yannick Hanfmann 6‑3, 6‑4 to reach the Hellenic Championship final, chasing his 101st career tour-level title. He will face either Lorenzo Musetti or Sebastian Korda in the final.

After T20I retirement, Kane Williamson joins Durban's Super Giants for SA20 2025Kane Williamson has rejoined Durban's Super Giants for the SA20 2025–26 season, replacing Bangladesh spinner Taijul Islam. The New Zealand captain's return comes after his T20I retirement earlier this month.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
